cb766bf4-249e-407e-870e-4c3fa3ef3623.description: This badge recognizes the completion of the custom Penn State Executive Programs' 'Supply Chain Advancement' program created for IBM. The goal of the series is to develop and refine skills to help the IBM Supply Chain organization maintain a global leadership position and remain at the forefront of financial health and tech advantage. Applying skills learned, participants focus on: innovations linked to the IBM North Star, thought leadership, intelligent workflow and developing a growth mindset.
cb766bf4-249e-407e-870e-4c3fa3ef3623.name: Supply Chain Advancement

issuer.summary: issued by Penn State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: 'Supply Chain as a Competitive Advantage' - In this sprint, leaders discuss competitive levers and changes that would put the supply chain on a path to outperform competitors. They will explore the concept of the 'triple bottom line' and consider how sustainability goals often intersect with objectives to reduce waste and make operations more efficient and safer.

'Building Continuity and Resiliency in Your SC' - In this program, leaders identify strengths and weaknesses in continuity plans, develop risk reduction plans, practice decision making and learn to manage risk levers through a simulated disruption. Leaders discuss ways to address supply chain design, buffers, operating flexibility, security and other levers to prevent or manage disruptions.

'Finding Opportunities in Your End-to-End Supply Chain' - This sprint reviews the factors that drive change across supply chains. Leaders learn why globalization, new technologies, omnichannel strategies, sustainability, and others are forcing supply chains to evolve. We explore why higher levels of performance come via cross-functional processes that integrate work done by functional teams and favor the performance of the entire supply chain as compared to siloed, functional excellence.

The final week of the IBM series culminates by inviting teams of participants to select an innovative idea generated during the program and consider how IBM might best leverage the concept to benefit the enterprise. Teams collaborate to review options, consider alternatives, and review potential financial benefits to IBM of executing the innovation, with a presentation to leaders acting as the final culminating activity of the program.

d4f7b1cb-e4ea-4e40-abb8-452a92297d87.description: This badge recognizes the completion of the custom Penn State Executive Programs 'Developing a Supply Chain End-to-End Mindset' program created for IBM. The goal of this series is to help the IBM Supply Chain organization maintain a global leadership position and remain at the forefront of financial health and tech advantage. Applying skills learned, participants focus on: creating sustainable competitive advantage, managing risk in the SC, and increasing SC alignment.
d4f7b1cb-e4ea-4e40-abb8-452a92297d87.name: Developing a Supply Chain End-to-End Mindset

issuer.summary: issued by Penn State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: 'Supply Chain Alignment and Orchestration' - In this Sprint, leaders use frameworks to evaluate alignment and collaboration, categorize functional areas as 'Traditional, Progressive or Leading', and consider ways to develop new synergies when managing client returns, moving from a demand- to market-driven network, and using analytics to drive efficiencies across the SC. To support application, leaders work in groups to determine how they will take action on one improvement opportunity.

'Managing Supplier Risk' - In this sprint, leaders explore SC risk management and mitigation, and take a proactive approach to protecting the firm and brand. Tools and techniques are used to identify and prioritize risks, analyze risks found, and develop plans to either prevent a future risk, or minimize the consequences if a risk event occurs. Leaders build a risk management matrix, discuss strategies to manage risk, and use a toolkit to develop risk mitigation plans.

'Strategic Leadership Within Your Supply Chain Organization' - This sprint makes the case for SC leaders to build a strong partnership with other business leaders and to tightly align the supply chain strategy to the organization’s corporate strategy. This program allows leaders to begin to understand how to configure and integrate activities to align with the approach the company is pursuing to build competitive advantage through cost management, differentiation, and focus.

The final week of the IBM series culminates by inviting teams of participants to select an innovative idea generated during the program and consider how IBM might best leverage the concept to benefit the enterprise. Teams collaborate to review options, consider alternatives, and review potential financial benefits to IBM of executing the innovation, with a presentation to leaders acting as the final culminating activity of the program.

The goal of this series is to help the IBM Supply Chain organization maintain a global leadership position and remain at the forefront of financial health and tech advantage. 483287ce-0dc5-4cb4-998e-6e7978160218.name: Supply Chain: Connecting Strategy to Performance

issuer.summary: issued by Penn State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: 'Aligning Supply Chain Goals with Your Corporate Strategy' - In this sprint, leaders to consider process-led transformation work that could strengthen the alignment between the supply chain strategy and the company’s strategic priorities. Leaders critically examine the state of supply chain assets to better understand: if current assets support the company’s effort to lead; discuss current level of SC flexibility and adaptability; and consider improvements to stay ahead of competitors.

'Value Generation for Supply Chains' - This sprint challenges leaders to consider the supply chain with an eye towards changing customer needs, globalization, digitization, and the development of a value added ecosystem in which functional silos are broken down in support of a sustainable network focused on value creation.

'Improving Supply Chain Agility' - In this Sprint, leaders consider the impact of SC agility on critical measures like: faster time to market, higher productivity, and more time spent on value-adding activities such as innovation, customer interaction, and problem-solving. Participants explore the strengths and weaknesses within their organization's supply chain and discuss how to build agility into the culture of their team(s).

The final week of the IBM series culminates by inviting teams of participants to select an innovative idea generated during the program and consider how IBM might best leverage the concept to benefit the enterprise. Teams collaborate to review options, consider alternatives, and review potential financial benefits to IBM of executing the innovation, with a presentation to leaders acting as the final culminating activity of the program.
